data.text: @atticusjade Honestly, I never thought of it that way. In that case, she would be a martyr.
@EatSleepMask Possibly she was aware of her susceptibility to COVID and feared  spreading it to her children, therefore eliminating that variable by suicide? Seems reasonable!
@SarahMur138 I was just thinking that there will be many stories to tell.
@EatSleepMask And here we are….. Hopefully we’ll get to tell our grandkids someday that we were on the right side of history.
@SarahMur138 I remember learning about the Holocaust in school and thinking no one would ever be that stupid as to let it happen again. I was way wrong.

@EatSleepMask Yep. The cognitive dissonance is astounding. Nobody questions either why we went from strict mandates to no mandates literally overnight. They can’t even entertain the idea that maybe we were lied to. It’s maddening.
@SarahMur138 No kidding. It worries me that people would be so quick to do it again. It also worries me even more that everyone is just willing to forget and pretend like it never happened.

@EatSleepMask Nope. We haven’t but we must ensure nothing like this ever happens again. We won’t even know the extent of the damage on our kids mental health (or own own) for a long time to come. I just wish people would hurry up and wake up to this charade already.
@SarahMur138 It is. Then despite what everyone thought, we have never gone back to “normal”.

@EatSleepMask So awful. So many people felt so much despair especially during lockdown. Just heartbreaking. I feel so awful for her kids. My children were of very similar ages when their dad died a few years ago. It’s something you never want to see  kids go through. 😔
